text: well when I received the script for
Chloe it was originally set in San
Francisco as I got more involved with
conceptualizing the project I realized
that that city had been so celebrated in
the movies and I began to think of
Toronto and the fact that i'd never seen
toronto play itself it seemed that this
was a really good opportunity to locate
a film in the city and use the
architectural and the topographical
features that make Toronto quite unique
there are these arteries that run
through the city there in the form of
ravines which are very unusual the house
itself is a house which overlooks a
ravine so there's this constant contact
with with these primal forces of nature
it's in itself a very strange place it's
almost set up as a as a as a glass box
and an aquarium because that's the way
Catherine sees her own family in a way
is through these filters through these
windows Allan Gardens is is in the heart
of the city it's a place that
Torontonians don't often visit and when
they do they keep telling themselves so
they should go back because it's this
incredible oasis we enhanced it by
building a greenhouse within the
greenhouse so when you're looking at it
in the film because there's this very
strong motif of glass you know we
treated the glass in this small set
within the set the Windsor Arms it was
really exciting for me because I I shot
a film 20 years ago called speaking
parts which was also set at the Windsor
Arms but that was the old Windsor Arms
it went it underwent a major renovation
it's a beautiful exterior and it's just
south of yorkville and it's a very Tony
hotel now it's where a lot of visiting
stars and you know film people stay
during the festival ordering issued well
the caffee diplomatic Oh is an
institution it's at Clinton and college
it's literally half a block away from
where we edited the film I think that's
one of the most thrilling moments in the
film for torontonians because to see it
kind of reinvented with these big stars
but also with this you know complete wet
down on the street major lighting
it sort of looks so spectacular
